chmod.title: Chmod Calculator
chmod.description: A dead simple calculator for Unix chmod permissions

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: In Unix systems, file permissions are managed through three (3) distinct classes/abstractions, the user or owner, the group and public. Each one of these can have read, write and/or execute permissions and, to represent those permissions, we can use a numeric or symbolic representation.

usage.title: How to use
usage.description: Check the boxes to give the permissions to each class. Each row represents a permission and each column represents a class. After checking all the permissions you desire for each class, click on whichever representation you would like to copy it.

todo.title: ToDo List
todo.description: Organize your tasks in a simple way

description.1: Click on a task's or list's title to edit it
description.2: Add tasks by clicking on the button above
description.3: Remove tasks by clicking on the remove button or by leaving a task's title empty
description.4: Click on a task's checkbox to mark it as done
description.more: This tool saves its data on your browser's local storage. Cleaning its data or accessing this tool from another browser will make it impossible to access tasks created from other browsers

workspace.title: Workspace

notification.title: Welcome to your workspace!
notification.more: Some tools save their data on your browser's local storage. Cleaning your device's or your browser's data or accessing them from other browsers/devices will make it impossible to access data created from other devices/browsers

description.1: 1. Click on the menu icon located on top-left corner

2.1: a. Check the icons to the right of the tool name to see how they can be placed in your workspace

3.0: 3. Select a position for your tool
3.1: a. Empty positions are indicated with a plus (+) icon
3.2: b. Occupied positions can be replaced clicking the replace button
3.3: c. ... or emptied without adding a tool by clicking the remove button
3.4: d. The workspace will favor placing tools on the main panel when they are removed from it or added to other panels

description.4: 4. Use your tools and quit by clicking on the power button or navigating to a different page
